Description:
DESCRIPTION:THE ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $10,000,000 TO FULLY FUND THE AWARD. 

THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (COMMONLY REFERRED TO AS THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW) IS FUNDING THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO SUPPORT EFFORTS WITHIN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED THAT VASTLY ACCELERATE SUB-WATERSHED AND/OR REGIONAL SCALE IMPLEMENTATION OF NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT REDUCTIONS WITH INNOVATIVE, SUSTAINABLE, AND COST-EFFECTIVE APPROACHES. ACTIVITIES:THE NATIONAL FISH AND WILDLIFE FOUNDATION (NFWF) WILL IMPLEMENT THE INNOVATIVE NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT REDUCTION (INSR) PROGRAM THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT, ADMINISTRATION, AND MANAGEMENT OF AN ANNUAL COMPETITIVE SUBAWARD PROGRAM AIMED AT ACHIEVING PROGRAM GOALS. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE SOLICITATION OF INNOVATIVE INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS TO ADVANCE REGIONAL IMPLEMENTATION OF WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS, EVALUATION OF PROPOSALS, EXECUTION OF SUBAWARDS, AND MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT OF IMPLEMENTATION AND ASSOCIATED WATER QUALITY IMPACTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NFWF WILL SUBAWARD FUNDS TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF REGIONAL SCALE PROJECTS AIMED AT RESTORING WATER QUALITY AND HABITATS OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ITS TRIBUTARY RIVERS AND STREAMS.OUTCOMES:THIS AWARD SUPPORTS ACHIEVEMENT OF THE GOALS AND OUTCOMES OF THE 2014 CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT, WITH EMPHASIS ON ACCELERATING THE RATE AND SCALE OF WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS TOWARD THE WATER QUALITY GOAL AND 2025 WATERSHED IMPLEMENTATION PLAN OUTCOME. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS REDUCTION OF NUTRIENTS AND SEDIMENT NECESSARY TO SUPPORT THE AQUATIC LIVING RESOURCES OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ITS TRIBUTARIES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THE INSR PROGRAM INCLUDE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM PARTNERSHIP, RESIDENTS OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED, HUMAN HEALTH, AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THE ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $15,000,000 TO FULLY FUND THE AWARD. 

THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (COMMONLY REFERRED TO AS THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW) IS FUNDING THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO DEMONSTRATE EFFECTIVE TECHNIQUES AND PARTNERSHIP-BUILDING TO ACHIEVE THE OBJECTIVES OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM AT THE SMALL-WATERSHED SCALE.
ACTIVITIES:THE NATIONAL FISH AND WILDLIFE FOUNDATION (NFWF) WILL IMPLEMENT THE SMALL WATERSHED GRANT (SWG) PROGRAM THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT, ADMINISTRATION, AND MANAGEMENT OF AN ANNUAL COMPETITIVE SUBAWARD PROGRAM AIMED AT ACHIEVING PROGRAM GOALS. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE SOLICITATION OF INNOVATIVE PROJECTS TO ADVANCE WATERSHED PROTECTION ACTIVITIES, EVALUATION OF PROPOSALS, EXECUTION OF SUBAWARDS, AND MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT OF IMPLEMENTATION AND ASSOCIATED IMPACTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NFWF WILL SUBAWARD FUNDS TO SUPPORT ON-THE-GROUND IMPLEMENTATION PROJECTS AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR ON-THE-GROUND IMPLEMENTATION. OUTCOMES:THIS AWARD SUPPORTS ACHIEVEMENT OF THE GOALS AND OUTCOMES OF THE 2014 CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS LOCAL WATERSHED IMPROVEMENT NECESSARY TO SUPPORT THE AQUATIC LIVING RESOURCES OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ITS TRIBUTARIES. THE SWG PROGRAM HAS DEVELOPED STRATEGIES TO MEET COMMUNITIES WHERE THEY ARE AND HELP THEM ACCESS RESOURCES - WHETHER THROUGH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, GRANT FUNDING, OR PEER-TO-PEER LEARNING -- TO TAKE THE NEXT STEP IN ADVANCING ON THE GROUND HABITAT RESTORATION AND WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM PARTNERSHIP, RESIDENTS OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED, HUMAN HEALTH, AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $350,000. FEDERAL FUNDS OF $1,397,703 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FOR AN ANNUAL SURVEY OF THE DISTRIBUTION AND ABUNDANCE OF SUBMERGED AQUATIC VEGETATION (SAV) THROUGHOUT THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ITS TIDAL TRIBUTARIES. THIS AWARD CONTRIBUTES TO THE GOALS AND OUTCOMES OF THE 2014 CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT, IN PARTICULAR THE GOAL TO PROTECT AND RESTORE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY'S LIVING RESOURCES, WATER QUALITY, AND VITAL HABITATS, INCLUDING A NUMERIC SAV RESTORATION GOAL (185,000 ACRES OF SAV).ACTIVITIES:TO ACCOMPLISH THIS AWARD'S PURPOSE, THE VIRGINIA INSTITUTE OF MARINE SCIENCE (VIMS) WILL CONDUCT AN ANNUAL SAV AERIAL SURVEY AND PROVIDE IMAGE-INTERPRETATION, MAPPING, AND WEB-BASED ACCESS TO MAPS DISPLAYING SAV DATA. FURTHERMORE, VIMS WILL CONDUCT ANALYSIS OF THE LONG-TERM TRENDS IN SAV BED SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION, DENSITY, AND SPECIES DIVERSITY, AS WELL AS IDENTIFY FACTORS LEADING TO THE OBSERVED SHORT AND LONG-TERM TRENDS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:AS ONE OF THE MOST LONG-STANDING MEASURES OF THE ECOLOGICAL HEALTH OF CHESAPEAKE BAY, THE ANNUAL SAV SURVEY IS NECESSARY FOR MEASURING ATTAINMENT OF WATER CLARITY STANDARDS IN CHESAPEAKE BAY THAT WILL RESULT IN IMPROVING AQUATIC HEALTH OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY. THE RESULTANT DATA ARE USED BY THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM (CBP) PARTNERSHIP'S JURISDICTIONS AND LOCAL PARTNERS TO SUPPORT HABITAT RESTORATION AND PROTECTION DECISION-MAKING, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO PERMITTING AND AQUACULTURE-SITING DECISIONS. BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE CBP PARTNERSHIP, STATE AND LOCAL AGENCIES, NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, AND ULTIMATELY THE CITIZENS OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED.

THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $350,000. FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,750,000 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR WRITING, EDITING, AND PUBLISHING THE BAY JOURNAL (A MONTHLY PERIODICAL) AS WELL AS THE ELECTRONIC NEWS SERVICE AND BAY JOURNAL WEBSITE TO INFORM THE PUBLIC ABOUT ISSUES AND EVENTS THAT AFFECT THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ITS WATERSHED.
ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL FOCUS ON EDUCATING AND RAISING PUBLIC AWARENESS AND INCLUDE DEVELOPING STORY IDEAS; CONDUCTING RESEARCH; WRITING, EDITING AND PREPARING COPY; PUBLISHING THE PERIODICAL 10 MONTHS OF THE YEAR; AND MAINTAINING THE WEBSITE. 
OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS PROTECTION AND RESTORATION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY ECOSYSTEM THROUGH INCREASED PUBLIC AWARENESS OF RESTORATION EFFORTS. THIS WORK SUPPORTS ACHIEVEMENT OF THE GOALS OF THE 2014 CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PARTNERSHIP, AND THE HEALTH OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $250,000. FEDERAL FUNDS OF $1,400,000 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO FULLY OPERATIONALIZE AN UNSTRUCTURED-GRID TIDAL WATER MODEL, WHICH WILL BE USED FOR THE ASSESSMENT OF THE CHESAPEAKE TMDL WATER QUALITY STANDARDS UNDER 2035 CLIMATE CHANGE CONDITIONS.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $528,200 ($28,200 OF WHICH REPRESENTS EPA IN-KIND). FEDERAL FUNDS OF $2,641,000 ($141,000 OF WHICH REPRESENTS EPA IN-KIND) ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM (CBP) PARTNERSHIP WITH TECHNICAL AND PROGRAMMATIC SUPPORT RELATED TO IMPLEMENTATION OF THE AGRICULTURAL AND OTHER NONPOINT SOURCE COMPONENTS OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED JURISDICTIONS' WATERSHED IMPLEMENTATION PLANS (WIPS).
ACTIVITIES:
ACTIVITIES PERFORMED UNDER THIS AWARD WILL FOCUS ON SUPPORTING STATE, REGIONAL, AND LOCAL PARTNERS, AND OTHER NON-FEDERAL STAKEHOLDERS TO BUILD THE INSTITUTIONAL AND PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY FOR ACCELERATED IMPLEMENTATION OF AGRICULTURAL CONSERVATION AND OTHER NONPOINT SOURCE PROGRAMS. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PARTICIPATION IN AND SUPPORT FOR THE CBP AGRICULTURE WORKGROUP, ASSISTANCE WITH THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF BMP VERIFICATION PROTOCOLS, DEVELOPMENT AND UPDATES TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED DATA DASHBOARD AND CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM WATERSHED MODEL, AND OUTREACH TO STATE AND LOCAL PARTNERS.
OUTCOMES:
THIS WORK SUPPORTS ACHIEVEMENT OF THE GOALS OF THE 2014 CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS PROTECTION AND RESTORATION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY ECOSYSTEM THROUGH CONTINUED TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO ADDRESS WATER-QUALITY RESTORATION GOALS AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC AWARENESS OF CHESAPEAKE BAY RESTORATION EFFORTS. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CBP PARTNERSHIP AND RESIDENTS OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED. 
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $1,000,940 ($56,400 OF WHICH REPRESENTS EPA IN-KIND FUNDING). 

FEDERAL FUNDS OF $5,484,544 ($282,000 OF WHICH REPRESENTS EPA IN-KIND FUNDING) ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM (CBP) PARTNERS WITH SUPPORT TO DESIGN, DEVELOP, UPDATE, AND MAINTAIN A PORTFOLIO OF WEBSITES, WHICH WILL SERVE AS A PRIMARY COMMUNICATION TOOL FOR THE CBP PARTNERSHIP. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF USER-FRIENDLY AND ACCESSIBLE WEB PRODUCTS THAT MEET THE NEEDS OF TARGET AUDIENCES, INCLUDING CHESAPEAKEBAY.NET, BAY BACKPACK, CHESAPEAKESTAT, WETLANDS WORK, AND CHESAPEAKE BEHAVIOR CHANGE, AS WELL AS THE DEVELOPMENT OF PRESENTATIONS FOCUSED ON NEW AND EMERGING WEB DEVELOPMENT TECHNOLOGIES AND TRENDS THAT MAY HAVE APPLICATION FOR THE CBP PARTNERSHIP. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS INCREASED PUBLIC AWARENESS AND PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT IN ADDRESSING CHESAPEAKE BAY WATER QUALITY RES

THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $526,330 ($37,600 OF WHICH REPRESENTS EPA IN-KIND). 

FEDERAL FUNDS OF $2,773,670 ($188,000 OF WHICH REPRESENTS EPA IN-KIND) ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO COMMUNICATE THE NEEDS, PRIORITIES, AND SUCCESSES OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM (CBP) PARTNERSHIP IN SUPPORT OF IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A STRATEGIC COMMUNICATION PLAN (PLAN); DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION OF PRINT, MULTIMEDIA, AND ONLINE PRODUCTS TO SUPPORT THE STATED OBJECTIVES OF THE PLAN, INCLUDING EXPANDED OUTREACH THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA, PUBLIC FORUMS, AND CONFERENCES; AND EQUITABLE DISTRIBUTION OF INFORMATION AND MATERIALS TO UNDER-REPRESENTED AND UNDER-SERVED COMMUNITIES. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS IMPROVED AWARENESS OF THE NEEDS, PRIORITIES, AND SUCCESSES OF THE CBP AND EXPANDED OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT BEYOND TRADITIONAL OUTLETS, WHICH WILL RESULT IN A BROADER UNDER

THIS ACTION  PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDS OF $499,999. 

FEDERAL FUNDS OF $2,499,761 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. 

WORKING WITH PARTNERS, THE ALLIANCE FOR THE CHESAPEAKE BAY (ALLIANCE) WILL SUPPORT CAPACITY EXPANSION AND INTEGRATION OF CITIZEN-BASED AND NONTRADITIONAL MONITORING PARTNERS INTO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM PARTNERSHIP THROUGH THE CHESAPEAKE MONITORING COOPERATIVE (CMC). ACTIVITIES PERFORMED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL ASSIST WITH IMPROVING THE CAPACITY OF CITIZEN SCIENCE AND NONTRADITIONAL MONITORING PARTNERS TO CONDUCT MONITORING; DEVELOPING AND IMPROVING DATA ANALYSIS, DATA MANAGEMENT, AND REPORTING PROCEDURES; STRATEGIZING DATA COLLECTION EFFORTS BY CITIZEN SCIENCE AND NONTRADITIONAL PARTNERS TO FILL DATA GAPS; AND COORDINATING AND CONDUCTING TRAINING FOR MONITORING PROGRAM INTEGRATION. THE ALLIANCE WILL PROVIDE SUB-AWARDS TO PROJECT PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS FOR THEIR ROLES IN THE COMPLETION OF THESE ACTIVITIES. THE OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF CO

THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $391,810. 

FEDERAL FUNDS OF $3,943,352 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. 

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SUPPORTS THE OPERATION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM&RSQUOANDS CITIZEN ADVISORY COMMITTEE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT ADVISORY COMMITTEE. IT INCLUDES ACTIVITIES TO COORDINATE THREE GROUPS THAT SERVE TO INCREASE REPRESENTATION, INCLUSION, AND ENGAGEMENT OF (1) WATERSHED RESIDENTS AND (2) LOCAL GOVERNMENTS. THE INTENDED OUTCOME IS (1) TO PROTECT AND RESTORE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY ECOSYSTEM THROUGH CONTINUED TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO ADDRESS WATER-QUALITY RESTORATION GOALS AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC AWARENESS OF CHESAPEAKE BAY RESTORATION AND (2) TO HELP FULFILL THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT COMMITMENTS AS DESCRIBED BY THE STEWARDSHIP GOAL AND ITS CITIZEN STEWARDSHIP, DIVERSITY AND LOCAL LEADERSHIP OUTCOMES. THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $3,395,112 FOR ADMINISTRATION OF A GRANT PROGRAM TO ACCELERATE IMPLEMENTATION OF AGRICULTURAL BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMP) IN THE MOST EFFECTIVE BASINS WITHIN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED OF PENNSYLVANIA. THIS FUNDING INCLUDES $3,295,112 TOWARD IMPLEMENTATION OF ACTIVITY 1 (BMP IMPLEMENTATION) AND $100,00 TOWARD IMPLEMENTATION OF ACTIVITY 2 (TRACKING, VERIFYING, AND REPORTING BMP PROGRESS). 

FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $16,975,560 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. 

NOTE THAT THE HEADER OF THIS AWARD ERRONEOUSLY REFLECTS IT IS A GRANT AGREEMENT WHEREAS IT IS A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT, AND THE HEADERS OF THE BUDGET DETAILS ON PAGE 4 SHOULD MORE ACCURATELY BE IDENTIFIED AS ACTIVITY 1: ACCELERATING BMP AND ACTIVITY 2: TRACKING BMP.  EPA IS IMPLEMENTING A NEW GRANT SYSTEM THAT WILL SOON BE UNDERGOING ENHANCEMENTS TO CORRECT THESE ERRORS.

THE WORK PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO ACCOMPLISH OBJECTIVES OF THE VIRGINIA CHESAPEAKE BAY TMDL PHASE III WATERSHED IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (WIP) AND SUPPORTS THE GOALS OF THE 2014 CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT THROUGH ACTIVITIES THAT DIRECTLY RESULT IN THE REMEDIATION OF NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION OR LEAD TO THE REMEDIATION OF NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION THROUGH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND ON-THE-GROUND SUPPORT THAT WOULD RESULT IN IMPROVING AQUATIC HEALTH OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.   THIS ACTION AWARDS $4,051,996 IN FEDERAL FUNDS FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF VADEQ'S PHASE III WIP.  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,766,805 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $963,443 TO SUPPORT NYSDEC'S EFFORTS IN REDUCING NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT LOADS IN THE SUSQUEHANNA AND CHEMUNG RIVER BASINS BY FOCUSING ON WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANTS, CONCENTRATED ANIMAL FEEDING OPERATIONS (CAFOS), MUNICIPAL SEPARATE STORM SEWER SYSTEMS (MS4S), AND LAND DISTURBANCE ACTIVITIES.  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $4,817,215 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

CHESAPEAKE BAY IMPLEMENTATION  GRANT  THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $1,980,540 FOR SUPPORT OF RECIPIENT EFFORTS IN MEETING ITS NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT ALLOCATIONS, WITH THE OVERALL GOAL OF ACHIEVING THE RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AND ITS LIVING RESOURCES.  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $8,080,000 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.
THIS ACTION FULLY FUNDS A NEW GRANT AWARD TO DCNR FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF RIPARIAN FOREST BUFFERS AND WATERSHED FORESTRY BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMP'S).

VADEQ 117E  THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF 1,392,214 TO AID RECIPIENT IN PROVIDING ENHANCED MONITORING TO IMPROVE THE ASSESSMENT AND MITIGATION OF SEDIMENT AND NUTRIENT LOADS TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $5,568,856 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $1,691,594 ($184,000 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING) TO ENABLE WVDEP TO IMPLEMENT PROJECTS TO PROTECT AND RESTORE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY'S ECOSYSTEM, FOCUSING ON NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT LOAD REDUCTIONS FROM WV HEADWATERS OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED, INCLUDING IMPLEMENTATION OF THE WV TRIBUTARY STRATEGY AND ASSOCIATED BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMP) AS WELL AS THE COLLECTION OF BMP AND MONITORING DATA FROM THE WV DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE.  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $7,757,324 ($520,000 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING) ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THE ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $900,000 TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY TRUST (CBT)  TO SUPPORT CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM GOAL IMPLEMENTATION TEAMS (GITS), DESIGNATED WORK GROUPS AND ACTION TEAMS TO MEET THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES, TARGETS, OUTCOMES AND GOALS UNDER THE 2014 CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT.  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,600,000 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO EMPLOY EIGHT PFBC STAFF IN THE STREAM HABITAT SECTION. THIS STAFF WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO CONSERVATION DISTRICTS AND LANDOWNERS FOR THE PLANNING, DESIGN, AND INSTALLATION OF STREAM HABITAT IMPROVEMENT AND BANK STABILIZATION STRUCTURES AS WELL AS OTHER STREAM AND RIPARIAN CORRIDOR BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMPS).  THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $464,213.   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,443,110 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY (MSU) OPTIMIZATION  THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP, IMPLEMENT, AND VERIFY AN OPTIMIZATION TOOL.   THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $160,821 ($9400 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING).   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $804,080 ($47,000 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING) ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,690,863 FOR RECIPIENT'S EFFORTS TO IMPLEMENT PHASE III OF THEIR CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED IMPLEMENTATION PLAN.  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $8,454,315 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

VADEQ CBRAP III  THESE FUNDS WILL ASSIST THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (VADEQ) IN FUNDING ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO REDUCE NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT LOADS THAT CAUSE OR CONTRIBUTE TO THE IMPAIRMENT OF WATER QUALITY STANDARDS IN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ITS TIDAL TRIBUTARIES.    THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,429,186.   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,407,452 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

CHESAPEAKE BAY TRUST   THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS THE CHESAPEAKE BAY TRUST (CBT) TO ESTABLISH AN INNOVATIVE FINANCING SYSTEM THAT WILL RESULT IN GREATER FINANCING SCALE AND EFFICIENCY IN SUPPORT OF WATER QUALITY AND POLLUTION REDUCTIONS DEFINED IN THE UPCOMING CONOWINGO DAM WATERSHED IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (CWIP).    THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $304,940.   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $708,062 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS THE CHESAPEAKE CONSERVANCY TO DEVELOP A SET OF TOOLS AND METHODS THAT WILL PROVIDE PARTNERS WITH THE ABILITY TO ACCURATELY TRACK PROGRESS TOWARDS THE CONOWINGO WATERSHED IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (WIP) AND JURISDICTIONS' WIPS SIMULTANEOUSLY.  THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $84,605.   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $512,119 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

CENTER FOR WATERSHED PROTECTION INC.   THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS THE CENTER FOR WATERSHED PROTECTION (CWP) TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT THE CONOWINGO WATERSHED IMPLEMENTATION PLAN AND ASSOCIATED TWO-YEAR MILESTONES IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE CONOWINGO WIP STEERING COMMITTEE.     THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $209,671.   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $833,426 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES SUPPORT FOR THE ADMINISTRATION AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE CHESAPEAKE CENTER FOR COLLABORATIVE COMPUTING (C4), INCLUDING OPERATING AND MAINTAINING THE EXISTING ENVIRONMENT, EXPANDING AND ENHANCING THE INFRASTRUCTURE TO FULLY MEET CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM (CBP) PARTNERSHIP REQUIREMENTS, AND ASSESSING TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCES TO ENSURE COST-EFFECTIVENESS AND EFFICIENCY IN SUPPORT OF THE NON-FEDERAL ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE MEMBERS OF THE CBP PARTNERSHIP.  THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,020,153 ($9,400 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING).   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $4,234,436 ($47,000 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING) ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS ACTION FULLY FUNDS PA DEP'S IMPLEMENTATION GRANT, WHICH INCLUDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO FARMERS AND LANDOWNERS, DEVELOPMENT OF A NUTRIENT CREDIT TRADING TOOL, AND FACILITATION OF THE WATERSHED IMPLEMENTATION PLAN.

THE CHESAPEAKE CONSERVANCY WILL PROVIDE UPDATED DATA TO INFORM THE MANAGEMENT OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL LAND-USE INFORMATION TO STATES, COUNTIES, AND LOCAL JURISDICTIONS ABOUT CHANGING LANDSCAPES AND HOW THESE CHANGES IMPACT ACHIEVEING WATER QUALITY STANDARDS; DETAILED HYDROGAPHIC INFORMATION THAT IS CRITCAL TO UNDERSATNDING HOW WATER MOVES THROUGH THE LANDSCAPE AND WHERE RESTORATION EFFORTS COULD BE LOCATED; OPTIMAL SITING FOR BMP'S FOR WATER QUALITY BENEFITS; TRACKING AND REPORTING TOOLS FOR BMP'S TO STREAMLINE PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION; AND GEOSPATIAL SUPPORT AND  ANALYSES OF DATA.  THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,080,000.   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $5,997,392 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

MDA CBRAP I:  THIS GRANT AGREEMENT FUNDS THE MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE TO SUPPORT THE GOALS AND OUTCOMES OF THE 2014 CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT BY SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCING THE NITROGEN AND PHOSPHORUS LOADS THROUGH AN UNDERSTANDING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF NUTRIENT MANAGEMENT BMPS.  THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,425,297.  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $4,137,069 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

MDE CBRAP III: THESE FUNDS WILL ASSIST MDE IN REDUCING NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT LOADS THAT CAUSE OR CONTRIBUTE TO THE IMPAIRMENT OF WATER QUALITY STANDARDS IN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ITS TIDAL TRIBUTARIES.  THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,044,659 ($50,000 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING).   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $5,983,977 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT FUNDS THE MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES TO SUPPORT THE OUTCOMES AND GOALS OF THE 2014 CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH LOCAL, REGIONAL, AND STATE AGENCIES THAT SEEK TO BALANCE HUMAN ACTIVITIES WITH RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND BAY RESTORATION PRIORITIES.    THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $4,100,143 ($9400 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDS).  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $6,262,670 ($18,800 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDS) ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SUPPORTS LOCALLY-BASED PROTECTION AND RESTORATION PROGRAMS THAT REDUCE POLLUTANTS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THE IMPAIRMENT OF WATER QUALITY STANDARDS IN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ITS TIDAL TRIBUTARIES. THIS WORK WILL HELP ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN THE WATER QUALITY NECESSARY TO IMPROVE THE AQUATIC SYSTEM HEALTH OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY ECOSYSTEM.   THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $6,000,000.   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $50,000,000 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

NFWF - SMALL WATERSHED GRANTS PROGRAM  THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ENABLES THE RECIPIENT TO SUPPORT LOCALLY-BASED PROTECTION AND RESTORATION PROGRAMS THAT REDUCE POLLUTANTS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THE IMPAIRMENT OF WATER QUALITY STANDARDS IN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ITS TIDAL TRIBUTARIES. THIS WORK WILL HELP ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN THE WATER QUALITY NECESSARY TO IMPROVE THE AQUATIC SYSTEM HEALTH OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY ECOSYSTEM.   THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $6,000,000.   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $50,000,000 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS IS A FIVE YEAR MULTI-YEAR COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WHICH WILL AID THE RECIPIENT IN PROVIDING WATER QUALITY MONITORING INFORMATION USED TO DEFINE THE NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT CONDITIONS NECESSARY TO PROTECT LIVING RESOURCES AND VITAL ESTUARINE HABITATS AND DEVELOP AND ASSESS WATER QUALITY CRITERIA WITH THE GOAL OF REMOVING THE BAY AND ITS TIDAL RIVERS FROM THE LIST OF IMPAIRED WATERS. WATER QUALITY INFORMATION ALSO SUPPORTS REFINEMENT, CALIBRATION AND VALIDATION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATER QUALITY MODEL.   THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,736,966.   FEDERA FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $7,793,004 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT AIDS PADEP IN PROVIDING PROJECT ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO REDUCE NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT LOADS THAT CAUSE OR CONTRIBUTE TO THE IMPAIRMENT OF WATER QUALITY STANDARDS IN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ITS TIDAL TRIBUTARIES.  THIS WORK WILL HELP TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN THE WATER QUALITY NECESSARY TO IMPROVE THE AQUATIC SYSTEM HEALTH OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY ECOSYSTEM.   THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,076,885.  FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $10,667,276 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

VA CBIG III THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ACCOMPLISH THE OBJECTIVES OF THE VIRGINIA CHESAPEAKE BAY TMDL (TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOAD) WATERSHED IMPLEMENTATION PLANS AND THE VIRGINIA MILESTONES, WITH AN EMPHASIS ON NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION REDUCTION PROGRAMS.  AS VIRGINIA'S LEAD AGENCY FOR NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION (NPS), DEQ IS RESPONSIBLE FOR IMPLEMENTING THIS GRANT.  THIS ACTION PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,777,622.   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNBT OF $5,555,244 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM'S (CBP'S) NON-FEDERAL PARTNERS WITH TECHNICAL ANALYSIS AND PROGRAMMATIC EVALUATION SUPPORT. THE PROJECT ASSISTS THE PARTNERS IN MEETING THEIR RESTORATION AND PROTECTION GOALS AND IN INCREASING THE TRANSFER OF SCIENTIFIC UNDERSTANDING TO THE CBP MODELING AND MONITORING ACTIVITIES. PROJECT FUNDING WILL SUPPORT SCIENTIFIC STAFF MEMBERS WHO WILL APPLY THE VARIOUS MODELING, DATA ANALYSES, AND GIS ACTIVITIES TO DEVELOP AND COMMUNICATE INFORMATION DIRECTLY USED IN DECISION MAKING FOR THE CHESAPEAKE BAY ENVIRONMENTAL RESTORATION EFFORTS.   THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $625,500 ($56,400 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING).   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $5,134,233 ($282,000 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING) ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

PROVIDES MODELING SUPPORT FOR THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM (CBP) PARTNERSHIP TO INFORM DECISION-MAKING ON THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MOST COST-EFFECTIVE, EFFICIENT, AND TARGETED NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT REDUCTION ACTIONS.  OBJECTIVES INCLUDE DEVELOPING A PLAN FOR THE NEXT GENERATION CB WATERSHED MODEL; DEVELOPING AND REFINING BAY WATERSHED MODEL CALIBRATION, VERIFICATION AND UNCERTAINTY TOOLS; DEVELOPING BAY WATERSHED MODEL APPLICATION AND ANALYSIS; AND CARRYING OUT TEAM AND WORK GROUP SUPPORT.  THIS ACTION PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $146,100 ($9,400 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING).   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,140,299 ($47,000 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING) ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

FUNDING PROVIDES DATA MANAGEMENT AND ANALYSIS SERVICES TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM AND PRODUCES ACCESSIBLE WATER QUALITY AND BIOLOGICAL MONITORING DATA AND INFORMATION THAT SUPPORT SCIENCE-BASED DECISION-MAKING. THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONTINUE TO RECEIVE, QUALITY ASSURE, UPDATE, MAINTAIN, AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO KEY WATER QUALITY AND BIOLOGICAL MONITORING DATABASES AND RELATED INFORMATION.  THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $94,825 (OF WHICH $9,400 REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING).   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $840,224 (OF WHICH $47,000 REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING) ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $108,400 FOR CSN TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL INFORMATION TO LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL STORMWATER MANAGERS TO ACCELERATE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MOST COST-EFFECTIVE NUTRIENT AND SEDIMENT LOAD REDUCTION PRACTICES AT EXISTING DEVELOPMENT, NEW DEVELOPMENT, AND REDEVELOPMENT SITES.   FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $866,600 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $1,887,368. FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $5,662,104 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO AID THE MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT (MDE) IN IMPLEMENTING AND EXPANDING ITS REGULATORY, ACCOUNTABILITY, ASSESSMENT, COMPLIANCE, AND ENFORCEMENT CAPABILITIES IN SUPPORT OF REDUCING NITROGEN, PHOSPHORUS, AND SEDIMENT LOADS DELIVERED TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AWARD INCLUDE OUTREACH AND COMMUNICATIONS RELATED TO MARYLAND'S PHASE III WATERSHED IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (WIP), IMPLEMENTATION OF MDE'S WATER QUALITY TRADING PROGRAM (WQTP); PROCESSING OF CONCENTRATED ANIMAL FEEDING OPERATIONS (CAFOS) PERMITS AND INSPECTIONS OF ANIMAL FEEDING OPERATIONS (AFOS), PROCESSING OF NATIONAL POLLUTANT DISCHARGE ELIMINATION SYSTEM (NPDES) PERMITS, UPDATES TO PROBABLE MAXIMUM PRECIPITATION (PMP) DATA TO IMPROVE THE DESIGN OF BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMPS), VERIFICATION OF AND REPORTING OF BMP IMPLEMENTATION, AND COMPLIANCE AND QUALITY ASSURANCE. SUBRECIPIENT:FUNDS WILL BE SUBAWARDED TO LOCAL COMMUNITIES THROUGH THE WATERSHED ASSISTANCE GRANT PROGRAM (WAGP) TO SUPPORT LOCALLY IMPLEMENTED STORMWATER MITIGATION AND NATURAL FILTERS PROJECTS, AS WELL AS TO PROMOTE LOCAL ENGAGEMENT IN THE WIP ACCOUNTABILITY FRAMEWORK. OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS ACHIEVEMENT OF THE WATER QUALITY GOAL OF THE 2014 CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT AND THE CHESAPEAKE BAY TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOAD (TMDL). THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THIS AWARD IS REDUCTION OF POLLUTANTS TO ACHIEVE THE WATER QUALITY NECESSARY TO SUPPORT THE AQUATIC LIVING RESOURCES OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND ITS TRIBUTARIES. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM PARTNERSHIP, RESIDENTS OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED, HUMAN HEALTH, AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDS OF $1,738,647 ($138,647 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING) FOR THREE ACTIVITIES:  ACTIVITY 1 PARTNERSHIP STAFF SUPPORT: $1,276,600 ($131,600 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING); ACTIVITY 2 SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL ADVISORY COMMITTEE SUPPORT: $424,000; AND ACTIVITY 3 SUMMER INTERN SUPPORT: $38,047 ($7,047 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING).  

FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $7,726,388 ($526,388 OF WHICH REPRESENT EPA IN-KIND FUNDING) ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY. 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM (CBP) PARTNERSHIP'S GOAL IMPLEMENTATION TEAMS (GITS), COMMITTEES, AND WORKGROUPS WITH ADMINISTRATIVE AND TECHNICAL STAFF SUPPORT AS THEY WORK TO RESTORE THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND MEET THE GOALS AND COMMITMENTS CONTAINED IN THE 2014 CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED AGREEMENT.ACTIVITIES:UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, CRC WILL CREATE AND IMPLEMENT A PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONALS AND PROVIDE STAFF TO THE PARTNERSHIP'S TECHNICAL, MANAGEMENT, AND POLICY COMMITTEES, GITS, AND WORKGROUPS; ENHANCE THE CBP PARTNERSHIP'S ENVIRONMENTAL DECISION-MAKING THROUGH SUPPORT FOR THE SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL ADVISORY COMMITTEE (STAC); AND DEVELOP A SUMMER PROGRAM THAT SUPPORTS STUDENTS INTERESTED IN LEADERSHIP POSITIONS IN CAREERS IN ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AND RESTORATION. SUBRECIPIENT:CRC INTENDS TO SUBAWARD FUNDING TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF SMALL SYNTHESIS PROJECTS BY COORDINATING TOPIC IDENTIFICATION, WHICH WILL INCLUDE A DESIGNATED FOCUS ON CLIMATE CHANGE AND UNDERSERVED STAKEHOLDER GROUPS, COMPETITIVELY SELECTING APPROPRIATE TEAMS TO CONDUCT RESEARCH, AND ENSURING THAT RESEARCH RESULTS AND FINDINGS ARE COMMUNICATED TO THE CBP PARTNERSHIP.OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE: INCREASED ABILITY BY THE CBP PARTNERSHIP TO MAKE COLLABORATIVE DECISIONS; INCREASED UNDERSTANDING AND AWARENESS OF ISSUES THAT WILL ULTIMATELY LEAD TO MORE SCIENCE-BASED AND EFFECTIVE PROGRAMS AND PRACTICES FOR CHESAPEAKE BAY RESTORATION; AND INCREASED PATHWAYS FOR SUCCESSFUL CAREERS IN ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH, RESTORATION, AND/OR MANAGEMENT FOR COLLEGE STUDENTS. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE CBP PARTNERSHIP, ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONALS AND COLLEGE STUDENTS, RESIDENTS OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED, HUMAN HEALTH, AND THE ENVIRONMENT.
